website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for a feature-loaded Android gaming controller.
pros: Offers advanced tactile feedback from built-in motors similar to other controllers
Wired connection eliminates the need for constantly recharging any batteries
cons: Controller is made of cheap plastics that can flex and bend during heavy gameplay

customer_reviews.title: pc game controller not bad
customer_reviews.text: good controller no set up worked good after 2 AA batteries not sure how long they;ll last used about 10 hrs so far
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Here I come again...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get back into gaming, this time on PC and I don't like playing using the keyboard. This is a great remote for PC and it feels solid, basically a clone of the XBox controller. NOTE: The letter buttons don't have a light on then, if you are new to gaming and don't know the which botton is which by default and play in th dark, you should take this into consideration. PS. This controller will not make you an awesome player, just allows you to play using a controller. Personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: AT Garza

customer_reviews.title: PLUG N PLAY, FEELS GOOD, SHORT CORD
customer_reviews.text: Works well, works easy just plug n play, good feeling triggers, and feels good in my hands. Definitely a great option if your looking for an xbox controller layout but want a simple plug and play experience for every game that I've tried so far. The cord isn't super long though so definitely want to be close to whatever system your using it on.
customer_reviews.author: GameRoom

customer_reviews.title: It works as designed
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly on my windows 10 machine. Built in rumble pad works well too. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: Great controller for the price
customer_reviews.text: Controller feels much like the 360 controller and happy with the purchase. The only negative and loss of a star is that the thumbsticks are very below average and my thumbs kept sliding off when trying to play. I had to order covers for the thumbsticks and now the controller works like expected. Thewere purchased off of Amazon and snapped on perfectly. The controller is now spectacular with no complaints after a few hundred hours of use. The controller required no software and downloading and was basically plug n’ play.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT an Xbox Controller
customer_reviews.text: I searched Amazon for Xbox Controller, this came up. Reviews say it's the best Xbox Controller. OK Great. The description mentions Xbox in the compatible list. Awesome. Except. It's not an Xbox Controller. I guess the seller thinks its a good idea to list compatible and incompatible devices in the same line. And I don't know why people in the reviews are commenting on it being an Xbox controller?
customer_reviews.author: THE LINDEN'S

customer_reviews.title: Quickly deteriorates.
customer_reviews.text: Update my rating - the left thumb stick quickly deteriorated to the point where anytime I try to input up and left, the circuit shorts, or something of the like and instead inputs full right. Product is going in the trash, and I'm investing in a real controller next time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rakowski

customer_reviews.title: Really good budget controller for gaming on Chromebook 3
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this controller on a Samsung Chromebook 3. It is working very well. This isn't an Xbox 360 controller even tho it's exactly the same. It's not made by Microsoft. You definitely have to read the instructions to see which mode you need it in but once you figure that out it works perfectly. It doesn't have vibration which sucks but this isn't for completive use. I just play N64, GBA, and SNES emulators on my Chromebook when traveling. It works awesome for that. Feels good quality to.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my teenage son; this is what he says about it: Good controller for both PC and PS3 gaming. Packaging was nice. It felt a little stiff and clunky at first but over time it has loosened up and feels smooth. Joysticks are less jumpy than most off-brand controllers. Only reason for 4 stars is the sticks are still not completely smooth and the bumpers are a little clicky but still work like they should. The overall plastic body of the controller does not feel cheap but the bumpers feel a little thin. It has good weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: A decent controller, if you can get past it's quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: I've owned the controller for a while now and I've belatedly realized this is actually a PS3 controller that tries to emulate a 360 controller on the PC - it's button layouts are even that of a 360 controller. It bumps into problems with some newer games that regard it as strictly a PS3 controller - the controller still functions, but you get queues on screen like "Press the X button" instead of "Press the A button." The vibration function also seems to only function with some games, and Steam big screen mode disables vibration and uses PS3 controller settings for this controller.
customer_reviews.author: T. Currier

customer_reviews.title: Died after four weeks
customer_reviews.text: Delivered June 18. Worked great. Comfortable, responsive. By July 16 it was dead. Windows wouldn't even recognize it when it was plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: E E Knight

customer_reviews.title: Controller has many issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this controller for use in a competitive fighting game so it is very important that it works as intended. The direction pad often inputs diagonal inputs rather than straight ones because it is too touchy. It also sometimes inputs random button presses when only using the D-pad, mainly the Y button for me. The turbo button often turns on without warning or reason as well and will spam button presses until you hold "BACK" and press the turbo button. Weirdly enough, when I actually try to turn on turbo myself it does not activate. Overall it's too unreliable for competitive use and I am very disappointed. -C. Denver (not account owner)
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Xbox style controller for PS3!
customer_reviews.text: Controller works great!! Especially if you prefer the Xbox style. I do because they've always been more comfortable in my hands. I do recommend getting the rechargeable one as well though if you're going to be gaming a lot. The battery life isn't the best as it just takes regular AA batteries. It's still worth owning as a second backup controller for a friend or yourself though!!
customer_reviews.author: Arrowslice

customer_reviews.title: Good Controller but not a XBOX Controller
customer_reviews.text: I have had this controller for 7 months. The right stick is now pulls to the left. My XBOX wired controller took years to wear out the sticks. What now happens is I have to put alittle bit of right pressure on the right stick to keep it looking forward when i run straight. If i don't i spin to the left. I guess that is what you get for 25 bucks compared to 60 for a XBOX controller.
customer_reviews.author: TheRavan

customer_reviews.title: Significant mechanical deadzone
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it was like this from day one, but after getting used to the controller I find it has a deadzone of 10 degrees on the right stick where no input is detected, detrimental to FPS games
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for sure
customer_reviews.text: I love this stick, it is such a good controller for the money! I have one issue with it however, the turbo button in the middle of the controller is already broke, it will turn on when pressed and then gets stuck in the on position, I press it again to turn turbo off but it just stays on. I have to unplug the usb cable from my pc and plug it back in to turn off the turbo. Also the trigger buttons are a little to squared at the edges making it a tiny bit less comforable to use than a real microsoft xbox one stick. But other than that I am still super happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Greaux

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This controller caused a surge in the USB port of my very nice and perfectly functioning laptop. Before that happened, it would not aim correctly, one of the control sticks was stuck to the right. Very bad product. If someone can recommend a good budget controller on Amazon please let me know. I have not been able to find one.
customer_reviews.author: scott davis

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning after 4~5 months. Have taken very good care of it, haven't used it too often.
customer_reviews.text: Same thing MANY others are reporting here now: 1.) Right stick starts inputing random directions on it's own, some examples: 1A.) If you move the right stick right, as you move the left stick around, the RIGHT stick will start randomly moving left and up or down on it's own, even if the stick itself is remaining stationary. 1B.) Sometimes the right stick will just randomly move in a direction all on it's own, regardless of deadzone settings, so it's not a simple sticky stick issue. It's sensor malfunction. 2.) DPad will randomly input A or B presses on it's own. Even the occasional X or Y. Overall just a fault, awful product sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Sendaiko

customer_reviews.title: Ok-ish but noticeably not a Microsoft controller
customer_reviews.text: I mean I’m just gonna be real with you. A little kid playing video games might not notice the difference. However, I play competitive PvP games and the layout is just slightly off, not even by much. I’m talking MILLIMETERS. BUT, it’s noticeable. I bought this because even the highest quality Xbox controllers suffer from analog stick drift. They’re only good for a few months. I was blowing through them like 4 or 5 a year; so, I opted for a cheaper option. This controller hasn’t started that yet simply because I don’t. Use it. I can’t use it. If you’re used to a 360 or xbone controller you’ll notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three Microsoft, and One-type controllers for my PC. The Microsoft ones used to be reliable, but that is no longer the case, hence my purchases. Another was light-weight and cheap, and gave it away after one day. Tried another Microsoft, and it's connections have failed in less than a year. THIS controller has perfect weight, grip, and feels very durable. Extremely pleased. Don't let the cheaper price make you hesitant, as it did me... It's the ONE you want
customer_reviews.author: Justin Andreasen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Controller
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice in the hand and feels like a quality product. You don't get the sense "I bought a cheap controller" when you're using it at all. Build quality feels comparable to what came with my XBox 360. I don't know how it would work for a hard-core gamer, but for my purposes (I wanted to play some games like Asphalt 8 on the computer and a keyboard would be cumbersome and less fun), it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far
customer_reviews.text: It's like an xbox 360 controller for a ps3. Very easy to setup and use. You just put two AA batteries in the back and insert the included usb stick into a usb slot on your ps3. Then you just push the home button on the controller to sync it. The home button on the controller will not how ever turn on the ps3. You'll have to push the button on the console for that. The controller does vibrate and the effect is fairly strong. I will update this review if I encounter any negative issues with the controller.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this controller
customer_reviews.text: So this is a good substitute from an Xbox controller and the price of one. It is a plug and play controller and that's really it. I purchased this to use on my steam account and it works flawless. I made some tweaks with the controller through steam with the controller layout. I love it and it feels and looks just like a Xbox one controller. Must have for PC gamers. Also I prefer the plug in one rather than the Bluetooth when playing on PC, again that's me but that is just user preference.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Looks and acts almost like an XBox controller!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to an XBOX controller. It looks the same and feels better than the xbox 360, but some of the buttons are kind of grindy. The only downside really is that the joystick is a little too smooth like butter, but it shouldn't take long to get used to. Easy setup, plug and play, overall a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you can
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year, the left joystick has malfunctioned to the point that it intermittently sends a “strafe/move right” signal. For a years worth at that price, it’s...not bad. But I would not recommend it and will not be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Brand Name Controller
customer_reviews.text: This controller is so awesome!! I get to play games with my boyfriend now and its so much fun. The controller is really easy and simple to use. You definitely save money because its not a brand name controller, but it works just as well. All the buttons and joystick stuff works well! Great if you want to connect the controller to your computer to play games on Steam. The product seems like it will last for a long time. The length of the wire is definitely a reasonable length for you while you're playing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ngov

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Get wireless model instead if you can.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great working PS3 controller especially considering all of the trashy other options. I do wish it would've been made like the original PS3 model controller instead of the XBOX style design and if that's an issue for you do not buy it. It's for my son and he love it although when I have to use it, I feel it works great and is made of high quality material but the design layout is not what I'm used to being a Playstation gamer all my life. I did end up buying the wireless model not noticing it was listed on here before buying this one and reccomend going with the wireless model instead. But does work great.
customer_reviews.author: Real Honest Reviewers

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: A great value option for those who burn through controllers for one reason or another. In my case, I tend to wear out the sticks on expensive controllers, so I switched to these. They last quite a good many hours of use, but start to stick off center eventually. Their lifespan is comparable to Logitech ones though, and those have grown ever more expensive. The controller doesn't feel overly cheap, but the buttons do feel a bit mushy at times. If you need budget controller, can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: OttTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Greatly enhances gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I went so long without this controller...gaming on my PC and tablet has never been so awesome. I really needed a controller to use with Skyrim on PC while it was hooked up to my TV so I always had to play with the laptop in my lap at an uncomfortable angle, but this controller made it soooo much better! Same story with the tablet which is a bit big to hold for playing Minecraft with, the controller simplifies it and makes it all the more comfortable to play with!
customer_reviews.author: LuluKitty

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are in no way up to par standard with x-box brand controllers, but they are built tough enough for my needs. The USB dongles have a very annoying red blinking light, even when not in use, which can be very annoying, but easily covered with a piece of electrical tape. The controllers have a built in auto shut off which is nice for saving battery life. Minimal latency and decent battery life make this a decent quality product at a very attractive price.
customer_reviews.author: Bones McLure

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 18 months. First the (LB) button spring went out but it was still playable. It slowly started to glitch and the thumbsticks now give inputs that I'm not giving. For example, when you try to move with the left thumbstick the right thumbstick causes the camera to spin left at maximum velocity. It's unusable at this point. I have tried re-calibrated and re-installing the drivers many times. Works for a few mins and then its back to a failed state. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Seems solid, but I can't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I've tried connecting it to two devices (a tablet and a PC) and seem to lack the ability to make it work. It comes with an instruction booklet with instructions that don't exactly match what I see on my device. I followed the directions to the best of my ability, but the controls just won't work on my screen. Plug in USB. Press the big round button for several seconds. Press the big round button again. The controller works moving around in the control panel settings but not in the game I opened.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Device never mapped to the Xbox 360 Driver that came from the manufacturer's downloads page. This should have been able to plug in and play right from the box like all the rest of the third-party controllers I've purchased. After spending about an hour troubleshooting device drivers I'm giving it a one-star review. Also, the casing is cheap and the LED lights inside are blinding for someone who prefers a dark space.
customer_reviews.author: NonieBot

customer_reviews.title: Works well, for light to medium gaming sessions.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband to replace the ps4 controller he used on his pc, so far it works well and comfortable to hold, being wireless is a plus in his case since the wires for the old controllers used to always get mangled up or he wouldn't sit comfortably due to the wire being too short. I recommend this controller for light to medium playing sessions however if you are a hardcore gamer i wouldn't recommend anything wireless, you don't want the battery dying on you while in a raid :P
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: almost the perfect windows xbox replica controller
customer_reviews.text: super happy with this controller, only reason for 4 stars not 5 is the analog sticks sensitivity. While they are progresively pressure sensitive bidirectionally, it barely takes a few millionths of a millimeter of movement before the speed incresases 10 fold. For 1st person shooters this is very hard to deal with, 'm hoping with more use and wear that maybe it will loosen up a bit so to speak. When trying to aim precisely in small increments I find a tiny bit too much directional movement on the stick and it jumps to warp speed movement. Other than that I absolutely love it, literally plug and play in 1 second.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan J.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Always skeptical ordering cheaper products on Amazon. This turned out a great purchase. I've been using this everyday since I got it and im happy with it. Doesn't feel cheap or like I could snap it if I squeezed. I thought the little design lit up but guess not. Or maybe mines broke. Either way I don't care rhe controller works great. Played my emulator with it and gta and works perfect. No setup needed i just plugged in and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Not Something I Can Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This controller is tiny. I wish I had my old 360 controllers to show you but they were not that small. Also the bumpers are difficult to press. The sticks move freely but no matter what software or setting I try, my character turns like they're in slo-mo. Cable is long and it worked with my Windows 8.1. I don't recommend this though. Spend a couple extra bucks and get something else. I folded and bought another Xbox One controller and that works great.
customer_reviews.author: AnnoyedCelt

customer_reviews.title: these Xbox controllers are very well made
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I got these controllers for this price they are very well made. whoever designed these controller should be kissed. it's flat-out ridiculous how you can get cheap controllers this well made but yet Microsoft can't. I use these controllers to play emulator games on the PC. once I get done building my PC I might add more these controllers, totally worth it. besides these days you got to have controllers cuz a lot of games we get for PC are console ports. and they're much easier to play with controllers
customer_reviews.author: Preston Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Fades Fast
customer_reviews.text: Got this for 17 bucks and free Prime two day shipping. It didn't feel cheaply made but didn't have the feel of an official controller. Everything works perfectly for me including the response of the joysticks. I got more than I expected for my money but it's obviously not the quality of official controller than costs two to three times as much and I'm ok with that! Update: Had it for like two months, treated it like it was made of gold, and the buttons have started pressing themselves, namely B. I wasn't expecting a miracle controller but I am disappointed. I wonder if I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jyve Turkey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, looks good, defective
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of gaming/computer items on amazon. This one seemed like it would be a winner, looks good comfortable to hold. Not long after the return window was over, controller developed this odd habit of thinking there was thumbstick movement when there was none, basically making gaming extremely annoying/impossible. DO NOT BUY. A controller should last more than 6 months without breaking.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Robust, smooth, comfortable, but lacks precision.
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed with this controller. Essentially, it's an Xbox 360 controller, or at least that's what Win 10 thinks it is. The build quality is really good, the buttons and sticks have a pretty good feel to them. I really like the soft grips on the sides. However, I think it's missing some precision in the sticks that an Xbox One controller would have. I play a simulation game, and precise steering a vehicle is really difficult. My Xbox One controller was better, but it had issues with the buttons after less than a month of use. Overall this controller is a good buy at under $20.
customer_reviews.author: DealBreaker

customer_reviews.title: Solid Made & Designed 4 Hardcore Gamers that R sick of Jamming Buttons
customer_reviews.text: Best solid controller ive ever had. Triggers and bumpers redesigned for hardcore gamers such as I. In last few months ive put over 2200hours on just 1 game so this will be the 1st of this kind. Wish i had this sooner instead of the 360 from original manufacturer. Those controllers had a tendency 2 stick or go dead after a while of using triggers n bumpers
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dennis

customer_reviews.title: So far not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working fine, As far as functionality goes the only real issue is that if you left go of the analog stick it will input the opposite direction when it springs back to neutral which isnt THAT big of a deal... My only real complaint is that the turbo button is pretty much useless as it will not work for the triggers or the d-pad which is very disappointing. If i had know that i would have gotten a different controller. If that does not bother you, Its a solid controller for the price
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M Spangler

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Only two things I did not like about this controller. First off it runs on batteries. Second, if you like to game in the dark, the light on the controller can be bright and distracting. I ended up covering it with electrical tape. As for the batteries, it seems to be power efficient. I haven't needed to change out the batteries yet. Overall it is a good product. It is comfortable in my small hands and it worked right away with my PC.
customer_reviews.author: whipador

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few third party controllers off of Amazon. This one is the best one I've used so far! The size and weight are very close to that of an xbox 360 controller, but maybe a tiny bit lighter. The buttons work fine, and the triggers are linear on an axis so then can be emulated to be used just like xbox controllers. The only issue I have is that when I use my R trigger slowly, it only releases to around 10% pressed instead of 0. If this happens to you, it is easily fixable in the settings of any recent game, or the deadzone settings of whichever emulator you use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect for racing games
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this controller seems well built, and has worked without lag or errors for the several months I've had it. However, my one complaint is that I bought this to play wreckfest (racing game), and the triggers that control throttle and brakes are either full on, or full off. There is no middle ground. This is why I detracted one star. I mean who is gonna race at half throttle anyways though?
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good Response
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that the controllers are different colors. It makes it easier to tell which is which when stepping away for a bit to grab a snack. The controller sticks move very smoothly. I the buttons responsed quickly which is particularly important in fast pace games like Rocket League and Overwatch. I use it for gaming on my PC while using primarily Steam and Epic Games platforms.
customer_reviews.author: G. Monstre

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from these people product is absolute trash they won't last more than a year. When I came across an issue they sent me 2 used controllers to make up for it and even those failed after a few months. Then when I contacted them again they told me I would have to buy another from them since its a year out. So that means they know that these won't last a year and just wait until it hits the mark until they can say it's not covered under warranty. They are scam artist don't but from them trust me.
customer_reviews.author: PRman

customer_reviews.title: Had potential, low quality overall.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this controller for four months. Felt good in my hands, decent enough weight to it. Worked as intended for what I paid for. Then four months later the left analog stick stopped registering properly. Would not function or would fight the camera depending on what game I was playing. The D-pad also started to fail at registering my inputs. I mainly played Rocket League and GTAV on PC with this controller. I took good care of it, shame it didn't last. Maybe I just got a defective controller, as other reviews here say its lasted a while for them. YMMV with this controller.
customer_reviews.author: AMV

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work Right
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my Nvidia Shield remote. The information about it said it was compatible and it would work but it did not. The buttons were out of sequence. There was some information on how to work around this but it was easier just to order a different one. Please do not list something is being compatible to a certain device if it is not completely compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pad, I think it's one of the best out there for the money. You know it's better quality than most just by their boldness in changing the Xbox button to their own logo, and taking liberties on the ergonomic side texture & design etc. They seem to stand by their name and seem proud of their work, that's rare and always indicative of the best products and companies in China. DJI started out this way. It performed way better than my original Microsoft Xbox controller did for quite a long time. My game felt way better than my older original one.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw For Adults
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a serviceable controller for kids or people with small hands. Being 6'3" with large hands, I found my fingers easily hit the bumped out battery compartment on the back. Everything else seems decent with this remote. It connected easy, it wasn't creaky and didn't feel cheap, however, as an "adult" controller, it doesn't really work unless someone has small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Why spend more for casual gaming
customer_reviews.text: I have 100 games in my library but I am only a casual gamer. This controller is perfect for people like me - inexpensive, durable, and well enough made. I might spend 20 hours a week gaming - this device fits the bill. Battery lasts much longer than a couple of weeks of gaming. I like this controller well enough that I bought two for my two PCs. I am building my nephew a gaming machine and will order one for him too. Pls mark this as helpful if it is.
customer_reviews.author: Coisa

customer_reviews.title: Not for racing games.
customer_reviews.text: Eh. Decent controller. Not recommended for racing games. The shoulder buttons are not responsive to distance presses. For example, need for speed didn’t work well because I could not control half throttle. Only allowed full throttle or no throttle. Worked well for Madded and stuff tho.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kollos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome controller!
customer_reviews.text: The gamepad feels very solid and it's very responsive. I've played about 50 hours or so and haven't changed out the batteries yet. The lights on the controller and the receiver are very bright though. At certain angles in the wrong lighting it can be almost blinding. Always play in a well-lit environment, folks! I have pretty large hands but my son's are more normal sized and the controller is comfortable for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Great compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Great controller. Plug and play compatibility.. I had issues with another off brand controller, yes it worked but it acted goofy, and a lot of games didn't pick it up as a controller. FIFA and rocket league picked it up right away as an xbox controller. Seems durable (i'm very rough on controllers, stuff isn't made for grown men I guess), but this one seems up for the challenge. I'll try to update if it goes to crap :).
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Radakovich

customer_reviews.title: Better and cheaper than microsoft controllers
customer_reviews.text: Many off-brand xbox-360 style controllers are pretty garbage, but this one is under $20 and feels amazing. The triggers and joysticks are little smoother and less sticky than the xbox controllers, and the d-pad is as good as the xbox one's. The grips are nice, too, and better than those grip skins that just sponge up dirt. I prefer easysmx > xbox360 > xbox one > other third-party. I was also able to get this to run on my macbook pro using bootcamp and downloading the driver from the easysmx website.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 months of use (but good vendor support)
customer_reviews.text: This was an OK controller for a bit. The spacing between the joysticks and the shoulder buttons was uncomfortable for a while, but I got used to it. After two months of playing Rocket League with this controller, both shoulder buttons are broken and only make contact when they're pressed on the extreme inside corners. From my first handling of the controller, I felt like it would have lasted much longer. Edit: I informed the vendor of the issues and they shipped me 3 replacements of the same model within the next few weeks. I was very impressed by that.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: It was fine for a while but developed a game ruining problem within a couple months.
customer_reviews.text: Started out fine and figured it would last at least for a while but it has developed an issue where when I'm walking forward it forces my camera to look left. As you can imagine this is unbelievably frustrating when in an intense moment of the game and your camera decides you need to look away from where you're going on its own. Really sad this didn't last longer than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this fora little less than 2 months and it isn’t working correctly. One of the triggers stops dropping down menus and one of the joysticks now pulls everything to one side without much touch. It will continually cause my screen to spin. Can’t do anything like that. I expected this to last longer and am deeply disappointed. Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Leticia Vela

customer_reviews.title: Works great on PC.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to play Sekiro on PC and later also used it to play Ori and Witchers 3 and etc. Work very naturally without issue. I will try to use this same controller to play Hollow Knight this weekend on my MacBook Pro on Mac OS 10.15 Catalina. I will confirm if I still need to download a driver to get it working afterward.
customer_reviews.author: iDOBBi

customer_reviews.title: Exilent controller! Especially for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the controller alot! The only reason it got a 4 on erganomics is because when i touch the start button and select button my thumbs rub the analog sticks, probably because i have large hands. A 4 on materials because the material for the cord where it conects to the controller isnt the best and already seeing some stretching in the cord sleeve. Could just be because the way i sit at my desk. Ignore the guy who complains about the joysticks being slipery, i have verry sweaty fingers and stuff and i operate them just fine. And if you expeirience an issue with them jiystick grip/ covers are cheap. Overall an exilent controller.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: 2nd purchase, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I like this controller. I received it as a gift 2 years ago and it worked well. After abusing that controller, not gunna lie, it finally started acting up so I bought the same model again. I'm happy with the performance and feel of this, and glad I don't have to deal with batteries since this is for my PC gaming. Only issue I have this time around is that the joystick buttons do not work. I cannot seem to find a means of contact for the manufacturer. Not sure if I can download a driver to fix it or if it needs replacement. I'd be happy buying again for the price if that means a fully working product!
customer_reviews.author: Marty S

customer_reviews.title: Extreme play and non responsive
customer_reviews.text: Has extreme play on the left analog while you press the B button or almost any other button. Its like a keyboard that you cant press all the directionals at the same time and controllers shouldnt have that old kind of firmware. If I had time to return it I would.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Worked great... for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this controller for all my gaming since I got it. But about a week ago, while playing, it suddenly stopped functioning. I had to play around with the center button AND unplug it several times before it would even respond again. Now, it functions, input works, but there's an inexplicable fault where it randomly starts trying to spin me left when walking forward (as if I were holding the Right stick to the left while moving forward), and circling the same way when walking backwards. This has made gaming both impractical and unenjoyable. I've had to go back to an older controller that bugged out and stopped responding in the past, but thankfully works again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Really good!
customer_reviews.text: Another 5 star review... really nice controller- works great and looks cool. Seems well built. Just one small issue: the batteries fit very snugly in the battery compartment. Once they're inserted, I can't get them out by hand- will have to use needle-nose pliers and very gently pull them out. BTW, The batteries are new amazon AA rechargeables. All in all, 5 stars. Just be prepared to do a little extra work to change out batteries if they turn out to fit too snug.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Durability a problem
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about 6 months and recently it started drifting. Release the controls and you will still drift, moving very slowly until you nudge the stick in the opposite direction. So why 3 stars instead of 2 or 1? Because until now this controller functioned flawlessly. Accurate, responsive and very good battery life. Every bit as good as the xbox one controller.
customer_reviews.author: scavenger

customer_reviews.title: Works on old MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on my decade-old MacBook Air! I ordered this so I can play games with my son. It works well. I don't know if it works on other platforms, but it seems like it would. It's very ergonomic and has far better build quality than anything else in this price range. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Archangel

customer_reviews.title: This controller just works...and that's good
customer_reviews.text: The word on this controller is this: for most games and emulators, it's plug-and-play ready. All I had to do was choose what the functions for a few buttons and got to gaming in seconds! The controller felt right in my hands, and I haven't cramped up even after several hours of play. The price is half that of most controllers I found and had a slightly better rating. After heavy use, plan to buy another, however, because the buttons and triggers wear quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This controller fits comfortably in the hands no matter your hand size. the buttons operate smoothly and dont stick during game play. You can use rechargeable batteries or standard alkaline batteries. I use energizer batteries in mine and the controller lasts a couple days from my tests.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Deadzone
customer_reviews.text: So this is actually a pretty solid controller, has several modes that you can easily enable (if you read the manual) to adapt to smart phones or consoles or computers. Good quality overall. Why 3 stars? Too big of deadzones on the triggers and thumbsticks, I tried calibrating it several times and that is not the problem. It's almost as if you cannot input anything from 0 to 40%. If your getting this controller for an android game or something this controller will blow you away, not so much for computer gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Tommaso Giannetti

customer_reviews.title: Just A Step Down
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the small side for those with big hands. The d-pad functions, albeit questionably, similar to the design of the XBox pad which is an unfortunate shortcoming especially compared to those present on a Playstation controller. However, the button and stick layout matches the XBox design so PC plug-n-play is a simple matter.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: If you are fine with a inexpensive wired controller, this is perfect for you!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a spectacular gaming controller! I brought it for PC gaming and it worked well right away! For most PC games it works excellently, I haven't had any major issues with it thus far and it is holding up nicely to say. My main complaint is that the blue LED light in the center of the controller is fairly bright in dark settings (specifically in your room in darkness). But is can be adapted to.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 4 full months
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomics are fine, but for being barely used (maybe three or four times a month) it broke surprisingly quickly. I bought it in September and it broke before the new year. It wasn't dropped or abused, it's just a very low-quality product. The defect on mine is that it doesn't register pressing up on the joystick at a specific point. I might try to pull it apart and fix it eventually, but a product that can't survive light use isn't really worth the time investment of repairing it before something else inevitably breaks. It's not worth dropping twenty bucks on, maybe ten.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Joystick drift within a year
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this controller, which I bought last March, until recently. It's a comfortable controller to hold, I had no issues with it for a year, but just recently the left joystick has been uncontrollably drifting/turning the camera in games I play. I haven't had this issue with a controller before and it was pretty upsetting to find this controller became unusable within a year of purchase. It doesn't seem to me that this kind of hardware should have such a short lifespan, and you shouldn't need to buy a two-year protection plan, even for $2 or however little for this kind of hardware that really shouldn't be failing that quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, blue light around center is annoying bright.
customer_reviews.text: These are basically a perfect replica of the Xbox controller, my only gripe with this is that the blue light in the middle is so stupidly bright it bothers your eyes in the dark. I’m going to put some tape over it or something, yes it’s that annoying since I play mostly in the dark with my projector. Other than that it would have been 5 stars. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Sina H.

customer_reviews.title: No longer vibrates, left stick feedback is dysfunctional
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this controller! Then after a few months it now no longer vibrates, and the left stick no longer works well so I can’t run in fortnite and now i can barely walk without it quitting. So unfortunate, I don’t know what could have caused this the controller sits nicely on a desk no cord issues or droppings, super sad to leave a negative review.
customer_reviews.author: BullmastiffMama22

customer_reviews.title: Best Third Party 360 Controller Available
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a handful of different 360 controllers over the years, and this is far and away the best option. Original Microsoft brand wired 360 controllers are now quite expensive. Many third party brands exist at a fraction of the cost but most have some combination of poor material quality, terrible deadzones or sticky buttons, really loud clicking shoulder buttons, etc. This model has none of those issues. For all intents and purposes it feels and plays like a genuine original. I would not hesitate to buy a second if I needed to play local co op.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Engstrand

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, Sturdy, reads as an xbox controller on my windows 10 pc. This controller feels solid in my hands. The joysticks are rubberized, as are the grips on the side. I stream, so I spend a lot of time with controllers, this one is a bit bigger than my previous controller, but it's definitely without any doubt a better buy over say... that $20 Logitech piece of flimsy plastic that looks like a dual shock controller.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Was Decent, But...
customer_reviews.text: The controller started out pretty decent, worked almost perfectly (the D-Pad has always been a bit janky). However, after having it for less than a year, I'm already starting to have drift problems with the left stick. Other third-party controllers I've used typically last at last until the one year mark. The controller is quite comfy, though, and all else considered, is a decent buy. Just don't expect it to last till its first birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Christian K.

customer_reviews.title: Great PC controller.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a controller for gaming so I specifically bought this controller after searching for high overall rating controller for a reasonable price. When I received the package in the mail, I opened the packaging and immediately plugged it into my PC and started gaming. All the buttons are working fine. The controller fits perfectly in my large hands and feels lightweight. Hopefully this will last at least for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Feels like an Xbox controller in hand and works great with the pc. Playing breath of the wild through an emulator and this controller links up great with cemu.
customer_reviews.author: Largo man

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, was pleasantly surprised with the quality. It also hook up very easily to a laptop or pc and makes it easy to transition from console to pc gaming. I saw no lag time in response to the control movement and the cord length is pretty nice so you font have to sit right next to the computer if your like me and have your pc wired to a big screen tv.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Green 808

customer_reviews.title: Good, until it isn't?
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I didn't have a single complaint about this controller! I had previously been using an Xbox controller for my laptop, but the thumb pad on a joystick decided it was time to die, hah. The switch to this was really positive! It was lighter, felt better in my hands, and my only occasional complaint was the light when it was on could be a little annoyingly bright, especially at night. But it's made it.... not even quite a year, and suddenly it's not functioning. :/ I'm going to fuddle with it a bit longer, but... So having trouble ranking it, especially as it could just be a one-off issue with mine. That's all I can speak for, ultimately.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 0 stars if I could!!! I received an email this morning from the seller saying “If they don’t work when you receive them contact us” I received them this afternoon and they do NOT work!! They knew they wouldn’t work before I got them? I am requesting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: bkk3539

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget controller
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great value for a PC Controller for those looking to save a few bucks. Great plug and play, didn't have to install any drivers, my computer picked up the controller and was able to use it immediately. It responds perfect in games, no imput lag, no wasted feeling in the controller button pushes. Sticks feel great and responsive. Buttons have great imput and don't feel soft or rigid. Only negative I have with this controller is it is slightly smaller in hand than your standard XBox controller so it feels a bit foreign at first, but you quickly adjust to it and it works without issue. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Josh T

customer_reviews.title: Promising start, but not made to last
customer_reviews.text: I initially found this controller okay, the right joystick stuck a little bit sometimes, but nothing major to warrant a full replacement. I also mentioned this to support when they reached out. I’ve had it for less than 5 months, and now the right joystick doesn’t input any motion to the left at all. I’ve also used it probably less than 20 times total in the time I used it, so I’d say it doesn’t really hold up for much.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Best 3rd Party controller handsdown for the ps3
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box this controller is great. The materials are good the ergonomically layout of the controls are also good aswell. This controller functions better then any third party controller out there for the ps3. I played call of duty ghost and did not notice any dead zone or lag associated with this controller that you would find on other controllers. Definitely would recommend to anyone in the market for a ps3 controller. After trying so many third party controllers.....I think this brand has found a new loyal customer in me.
customer_reviews.author: rashad mcrae

customer_reviews.title: It works well until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: If you need a controller to play games on your pc and you are a cheap bastard like me, then get this controller. It works well, is plug and play and its inexpensive. Edit: this controller lasted me one playthrough of Witcher 3 then the left joystick died.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Gorey

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and plays extremely well!
customer_reviews.text: I own both an Xbox 360 and an Xbox One S and was very skeptical about how this controller would feel and function. Out of the box it is an attractive controller and it was fairly easy to setup on Windows 10. After a few minutes of playing with it I started liking it even more as it feels very comfortable and it does not lag at all. Controller worked with all my games and has definitely met my standards. I recommend this product to anyone looking for a less expensive wired controller for PC.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with good feedback
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using the game pad for two days so can't speak to longitivtiy. The game pad is comfortable to hold, the dual vibration motors provide excellent feedback, the buttons feel solid when pressed. So far I am very pleased with this game pad.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good controller
customer_reviews.text: Overall this controller works well, and it's plug and play on windows10. I have been using it for GE3, Tokiden1/2, atelier series, and they all worked. Material quality is acceptable for it's price. But I have noticed that the Dpad has small issue sometimes while pressing down it will react to left or right. And sometimes it even reacts to A or B botton. I guess it's because the Dpad is slightly off. _____Updated I emailed the seller, and they recommened me to update the driver. After updating it, the problem was still not solved. And they decided to send me a new replacement. For this, I will give them five stars!
customer_reviews.author: syq199688

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This works very well on my computer, and works with my game ROMS nicely. It took me a minute to figure out how to configure the controller to the game but after watching a short Youtube Video, it is actually quite easy. Makes gaming significantly easier than it had was when using the keyboard. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: EcoFriendlyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Was a fine controller for about 6 months of light use, then joystick went bad
customer_reviews.text: I used this lightly for a while after buying it, and it was fine aside from the needlessly bright light in the middle of the controller. But then the left joystick started malfunctioning, when i'd press one direction it would end up pointing the opposite direction when you let go. Not really a way to work around that, seems like just cheap components that failed quickly. I'd suggest looking elsewhere if you want more than a couple months worth of use before you have to trash it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Easton

customer_reviews.title: this really sucks for me
customer_reviews.text: First off I use it almost every day with my laptop. But the right button is kind of going out on me. Considering the number of games I have that rely on that button, this really sucks for me. And if I've left it idle for too long, I'll have to unplug it and plug it back in. Overall, it's been a great controller. I just expected it to last longer
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Mounts

customer_reviews.title: Makes a better gift than what I could do with it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 64,think my game days are over. I tried a couple of games and they gave me a head ache trying to figure them out and I couldn't figure out how to use the controller. I ended up giving it too my best friend boy he'll be able to figure it out. But it looked like fine quality workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Gaige

customer_reviews.title: Controller Malfunctioned Less Than 2 Months After Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This controller feels great and worked wonderfully for about a month or so until the right analog stick started to squeak and then periodically get stuck (as shown in the picture). I’ve had it for less than 2 months, and I really don’t PC game that much, so it can’t be from excessive use—I went from being quite pleased with this product to disappointed with how quickly it took a dump on me. Other reviews for it on here are great, which is why I bought it, so maybe I got a dud? These things happen. Either way, I’m dissatisfied with my purchase, and I probably should’ve just ponied up the dough for a Microsoft controller.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost a year
customer_reviews.text: The controller was fine- but it hasn't been even a full year and the d-pad down arrow is busted. It's seen almost daily use, I would not consider it intense gamer level - i'm more of a casual so....I guess it's ok but not the best ever
customer_reviews.author: Bookwyrm

customer_reviews.title: I used it for Team Fortress...
customer_reviews.text: I got used to playing COD on Xbox, then now that my PC is up to snuff I can play shooters there I figured I'd play some PC games. Problem is I now suck with using the keyboard and mouse. This is a perfect option if you got used to xbox controllers and want to play on the PC. Now I'm not getting owned (as much).
customer_reviews.author: Nate A

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels great in the hand, but unfortunately mine didn't last very long.
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months I noticed the left axis would want to move to the right even without touching the stick, started out as a very rare occurrence and ramped up over time. After about 6 months of light use, left bumper has stopped responding completely. Can't use it due to those reasons. Unfortunate because it feels great in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: John
